column1: Narrator : The acrid smell of steel and iron floats in the air, as the crew hears shouts from men.
Narrator : It’s a military camp, and a guard is blocking the entrance.

column2: Narrator : The soldier who was guarding the door is laying dead on the floor.
column4: OtherSpeak : How dare you come back here?!

column8: OtherSpeak : I’ve got my eye on you.
column9: OtherSpeak : Son of a cow! You’re CAPITAINE

column6: OtherSpeak : The Chief’s gonna want to meet you.
column8: OtherSpeak : There’s something fishy about you…
column9: OtherSpeak : Your head is on all the wanted posters.

column8: OtherSpeak : What do you want here?
column9: OtherSpeak : How dare you show up like this, criminal scum!
OtherSpeak : I’m taking you to the chief, NOW!
Choice : Hah! I'd like te see ye try! (attack)
OtherSpeak : Then you’ll get what you’ve earned

column1: OtherSpeak : You can turn you heels and go back from where you came.
column3: OtherSpeak : Not before helping us with something...

column8: OtherSpeak : You will always be welcome here!

column3: OtherSpeak : That makes sense… Come in.
column5: PlayerSpeak : Maybe this will convince you…
column6: PlayerSpeak : I don’t have this kind of money…

column5: OtherSpeak : Don’t tell anything to the boss..

column1: PlayerSpeak : You gonna taste the steel of my sword!
Narrator : The soldier who was guarding the door is laying dead on the floor, the door open behind her.
OtherSpeak : What is all this noise?!
OtherSpeak : These ruffians killed our pal! Let's avenge them!
Narrator : The camp isn’t massive. A bonfire is burning in the center and a few soldiers are drinking casually around it.
Narrator : There’s a big tent on a small hilltop, further in the camp. Must be the barrack’s headquarters.

column2: Choice : Anyone of you people want to travel the ocean ? (member)
column7: Choice : What’s going on around here ?
column8: Choice : I wanna speak to your boss.
column17: OtherSpeak : If we know anything about it ?
column30: OtherSpeak : If it isn’t our dear savior !

column14: OtherSpeak : The captain of a pirate ship we sank kept mentioning it.
column15: OtherSpeak : Sorry, I don't know what that is.
column29: OtherSpeak : If only we had cards
column30: OtherSpeak : From now on it’s blackjack all day long

column14: OtherSpeak : They were going to DIRECTIONTOFORMULA.
column17: OtherSpeak : He’s been tracking down every ship
OtherSpeak : Scrutinizing every island that links ot it.

column15: Choice : Come and find it with us! (member)
column27: OtherSpeak : You already took a buddy of ours

column17: OtherSpeak : Go and speak to him.
column18: OtherSpeak : You kinda killed him remember ?
column25: OtherSpeak : My only dream is to set sail
column27: OtherSpeak : Just leave us between pals

column16: OtherSpeak : What the hell, why not!
column18: OtherSpeak : But you could still go and search around his tent.

column30: OtherSpeak : How can I thank you ?

column22: OtherSpeak : No, it’s still better here than a harsh life at sea.

column30: Choice : I could use a hand on the boat (member)

column31: OtherSpeak : We’ll spare some of our rations

column9: OtherSpeak : Alright, I’ll make it clear.

column11: Choice : It’s out of the question. (attack)

column1: Choice : I’ve been told you can help me.
column11: OtherSpeak : Then you are hereby sentenced to die. Right here and now!

column9: OtherSpeak : Alright, that's your stale cleared.
column10: OtherSpeak : You haven’t got the money?

column5: OtherSpeak : We were kind enough to let your lot in.
column9: OtherSpeak : We’ll still keep an eye on you. Get out.
column10: OtherSpeak : Sorry lad, nothing personal but the law is the law.

column5: OtherSpeak : What else do you want?
column10: OtherSpeak : I’ll execute your sentence right here and now!
column13: OtherSpeak : I’ll end you, you rats!
column16: OtherSpeak : Depends if chief’s okay about it

column1: OtherSpeak : Someone of your renoun ? With pleasure
column15: OtherSpeak : I’ve always wanted to wake up to the sound of the waves

column17: Choice : How would he mind if you’re 1000 miles away… (cha)

column18: OtherSpeak : Sorry, there’s too much work here

column5: Choice : Could you spare any men?

column14: OtherSpeak : Is there anything I can do for you ?

column6: OtherSpeak : Sorry, we need all the hands we can get.

column24: Choice : Let me see another man of yours (other)
OtherSpeak : I was the last available

column14: OtherSpeak : You’re definetly a mountain of goodness !
column17: OtherSpeak : I’ve probably got one or two laying around and doing nothing

column4: OtherSpeak : As a matter of fact, I have.

column1: OtherSpeak : Yep, a good part of the boats we do controls on talk about it
column2: OtherSpeak : Yes but I never paid attention.
column4: OtherSpeak : I’m a big fan of the local myths and legends

column2: OtherSpeak : If you want my opinion, it’s a load of loony business.
column4: OtherSpeak : And I’ve been compiling research on it
Narrator : The head of the barrack combs CAPITAINE with his look, as if he had doubts about revealing such informations.

column1: OtherSpeak : You seem like an honest person…
OtherSpeak : And I have made my first very proud discovery.
OtherSpeak : In all the boats and villages I investigated.
OtherSpeak : A sort of runic spell or ancient locution kept on showing.
OtherSpeak : Though I’m not sure what it supposed to mean.
OtherSpeak : Yeah I have a few in the back cabin I can trade.
column4: OtherSpeak : Yes but only for my men.
Choice : I guess I’ll take them by force! (attack)

column1: OtherSpeak : There you go, as promised.
OtherSpeak : Ahah! You fell right in my trap, you idiot!
OtherSpeak : Or die right here, right now by our hand.
OtherSpeak : Doing it the hard way it is, then!

column3: OtherSpeak :  Don’t ever come back here, unless you want to give us more money, capiche?

column2: Choice : He tried to steal my money! (cha)
OtherSpeak : Yeah, he did that sometimes...
column4: OtherSpeak : Yeah, right! Our chief tried to steal from you? More likely the other way around!

column2: OtherSpeak : You know what, I’ll let this one slide.
OtherSpeak :  Alright, keep a low profile

column1: Narrator : The camp is empty, but the bonfire still burns. There’s only a handful of cabins, and an immense tent, that seemed to be the headquarters.

column2: Choice : (sleep by the bonfire until NEXTTIME) (sleep)

column5: PlayerSpeak : It’s an armory, but it's empty...
column6: PlayerSpeak : Just a bunch of random things...

column1: Narrator : The tent is absolutly empty. Only a desk and a weapon rack were left.

column2: Narrator : There is a gigantic map on the desk. It seemed the cap’tain of those soldiers was turning the ocean upside down to look for NOMTRESOR
Narrator : A sort of giberish word is scrambled in ink next to the phrase « FOUND IT »
